poem:
"Upon Reading M Emmet Walsh's Obituary"

M Emmet Walsh, a chameleon
in a world of mask.
His essence woven into
each odd and unassuming facade,
more truthful than the rest.
In his mere presence,
the story bloomed,
like the red wheelbarrow
glazed with rain.
Now, he whispers from the screen,
each role a testament—
his legacy, a garden of characters,
forever flourishing.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "M Emmet Walsh obituary M Emmet Walsh, who has died aged 88, was one of the few character actors who could be pivotal, if not key, to almost every film he was in. His ability to define any role could tell the audience more about what they were seeing than all the leads put together. This was literally true of the role for which he became famous, as the private detective Loren Visser in the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
